questions.question: What is the purpose of the @SpringBootApplication annotation?

options.A: It is used only for enabling Spring Security in a Spring Boot application
options.B: It is a combination of @Configuration, @EnableAutoConfiguration, and @ComponentScan annotations
options.C: It is used to define REST endpoints in Spring Boot applications
options.D: It is required to connect to a database in Spring Boot applications

questions.question: What is the difference between checked and unchecked exceptions in Java?

options.A: Checked exceptions are checked at compile-time while unchecked exceptions are checked at runtime
options.B: Checked exceptions are subclasses of Error while unchecked exceptions are subclasses of Exception
options.C: Unchecked exceptions must be handled with try-catch blocks while checked exceptions are optional to handle
options.D: Checked exceptions are faster to process than unchecked exceptions

questions.question: Which of the following correctly describes Spring Security's basic authentication mechanism?

options.A: It encrypts all data transmitted between client and server
options.B: It uses username and password stored in HTTP headers encoded in Base64
options.C: It requires a client-side certificate for authentication
options.D: It relies on JSON Web Tokens (JWT) for authentication

options.B: A principle where the control of object creation and lifecycle is transferred to a container
options.C: A technique to convert user input into database records
options.D: A security mechanism to protect against SQL injection

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a standard Java naming convention?

options.A: Package names start with lowercase letters and use reverse domain naming (e.g., com.company.project)
options.B: Class names start with uppercase letters and use CamelCase (e.g., CustomerService)
options.C: Constant variables use uppercase letters with underscores (e.g., MAX_VALUE)
options.D: Method names start with uppercase letters and use CamelCase (e.g., GetCustomerDetails)

options.D: Java originally supported multiple inheritance but it was removed in Java 5

questions.question: Which of the following statements correctly describes the contract between hashCode() and equals() methods in Java?

options.A: Objects that are equal must have the same hashCode, but objects with the same hashCode don't need to be equal
options.B: Objects with the same hashCode must be equal, but equal objects don't need to have the same hashCode
options.C: Objects that are equal must have different hashCodes to avoid collisions
options.D: There is no formal relationship between equals() and hashCode(); they can be implemented independently

questions.question: Which statement about ReadWriteLock in Java is NOT correct?

options.A: Multiple threads can acquire the read lock simultaneously if no thread holds the write lock
options.B: A thread can acquire the write lock if no other thread holds the read or write lock
options.C: ReentrantReadWriteLock allows downgrading from a write lock to a read lock without releasing the write lock
options.D: ReentrantReadWriteLock guarantees that readers will always have priority over writers to prevent writer starvation

questions.question: In a Spring web application, what is the correct behavior when multiple HTTP requests access a bean with 'request' scope?

options.A: All requests share the same bean instance
options.B: Each request gets its own bean instance, which is destroyed when the request completes
options.C: The first request creates the bean instance, and subsequent requests reuse it until the application shuts down
options.D: Each request creates a new bean instance that lives until the HTTP session ends

options.C: Spring Security automatically refreshes expired JWTs without requiring user re-authentication
options.D: The JWT signature is used to verify that the token hasn't been tampered with
